caption: Brickyard provided a terrific experience from top to bottom.  Meal consisted of oysters, salad, ribeye, baked potato, and huckleberry cobbler.  The steak was flavorful and cooked perfectly.  Staff were all professional and courteous and demonstrated excellent teamwork.  I’d be happy to dine here again in the future.

This is my 3rd review, previously rated it 1 star (based on a poor experience) and now I give it 5 stars. Absolutely amazing service!! My favorite place to dine in Boise by far. Great atmosphere, consistent, and feels like home. Sometimes the temperature on steaks can be a little off, but otherwise top notch. The assistant server “Brenna” (?) is amazing, she is just so personable and to be honest she makes the experience! They knew what they were doing when they hired her. The server Jonathan is top notch, always on his game and incredibly professional. We adore them both and can’t say enough good things about them. So glad we gave them another chance after our first experience, we’ve now been more than a handful of times and always had a great evening. Highly recommend all of the above!

Service was top notch, drinks were great but food was sub par.. steak was great quality but it had absolutely no flavor. My steak was over cooked and my girlfriends was undercooked. The people’s steaks sitting next to us were also not cooked properly. For a $145 meal, I was not impressed at all.
We highly recommend The Brickyard! Amazing food, excellent service and atmosphere!!

What can I say, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is top notch ...but the service? Second to None. I wanted to surprise my girlfriend for her birthday with a few special requests and the brickyard staff went above and beyond to accommodate. The staff at every single level from the waiters to the bus boys, the clerk's to the managers were so professional and inviting. For two hours....we forgot the pandemic existed, it was that nice of a dining experience. I'll be coming back for sure.

We were visiting Boise and we walked by the restaurant Brickyard and peeked in the window.  It looked liked a lovely restaurant so we made plans to eat there on Saturday night.  I read the google review about going home with muffins and tasting peanut butter mashed potatoes (!) The service was impeccable. (Shout out to Jonathan) It was a hard decision because everything sounded so good.  My husband and I ended up getting the same entree, Beef Wellington. Around the time our soup and salad arrived, the live piano music began.  I’ve been to many restaurants where the live music takes over and it’s hard to have a conversation over the music...however, the music volume was perfect.  The whole experience was lovely.  I would definitely recommend it!
Great New York steak and the prices are reasonable.  They give you a muffin to take home for breakfast the next day.  I have been here many times and never disappointed.
Food delicious, excellent service, beautiful people, so nice atmosphere, 1000% one of the best places for dinner, our server Johnathan coolest guy in world. Thank you!!!

My husband and I loved the service, live piano, and of course the food. We were very impressed with the amount of thought and effort that was put toward making our meal a merry experience.  We were especially pleased by the breakfast muffins they gave us on our way out. Jonathan was a very attentive and competent server.

Best Food I have had in years.  Suggestion start with the Warm Double Chocolate Cookie.  It's The Bomb..The entire meal was fantastic.  Accompanied by a piano music to make the dinner even better. Best of Boise !!

The BEST of Boise! To start, the restaurant is small and beautiful! A lovely lady played the piano throughout the evening. Our server, John, was amazing! Now the food... over the top! Husband said the rib eye was the best he has ever had. The peanut butter mashed potatoes have a unique flavor and were delish! I had the special which was lobster ravioli with a filet. Unbelievable! They are not doing the salad cart but you still pick all of your toppings and they make each salad individually.  The crab dip was so creamy and made with real crab. The cocktails were perfect and the salted Carmel cookie and ice cream dessert was so good! Oh, and they send you off with muffins for the morning! Absolutely amazing! 10 stars!
Love the ambiance, pleasant staff, truly delicious gourmet steak. As well as dope drinks! Accompanied by the extra-mile muffin they give you to take home... Unforgettable

My wife and were celebrating our 17th anniversary last Saturday and decided to have dinner at The Brickyard. Our waiter Avery was very knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent service. Food was great and the drinks as well. Nice quiet atmosphere were we could have a conversation without shouting. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family.
Delicious food, relaxing ambiance with the live piano
Oh my GOD! Amazing! Had the Chateau Briande. So excellent. Every Bite! Thank you!.
The food was excellent! Steak was done perfectly and the huckleberry cobbler is delicious! The service was excellent! Definitely will be back.
Amazing food & experience!

The husband and I visited The Brickyard this past Saturday night and it was fantastic. Service was amazing, the food was phenomenal, and the drinks were strong. The peanut butter mashed potatoes were out of this world delicious and hands down, our favorite food item of the night. Appetizers were generously portioned. We definitely recommend the calamari and the Dungeness crab dip! For main courses, my husband ordered the elk tenderloin, and I had the short ribs. Although the elk portion was absolutely tiny, both dishes were full of complex flavors that mingled together beautifully. The only complaint we had was the mushroom risotto was still VERY crunchy. It was a very busy night there though, so we understand mistakes happen. We'll definitely be back!

This was our first time at the Brickyard and I wish we'd come sooner! I have been meaning to check it out for awhile, but never got around to it til now. We came to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary and it was great! The food is outstanding and the staff were all very friendly and helped us enjoy our day. It was nice to get out for special dinner in spite of everything going on in the world right now. Current events did not detract from the atmosphere or our enjoyment of the restaurant at all. Definitely plan to come back sooner rather than later.
Great food and great staff!!! Try the Godfather drink. You will love it.
Incredible food and service

Anniversary dinner. Our experience started off strong. The baked Brie was delicious. We also had the potato and French onion soups, which once again was delicious. The main reason I chose the Brickyard is for their Beef Wellington which is hard to find anywhere now days. I was taught how to make Beef Wellington at 16, and have loved it ever since. Once we got our main course, that’s when things started to go south. First off, my wife had their seafood dish. The pasta was delicious, the prawns weren’t overcooked, awesome. The scallops on the other hand were way too salty, and the bacon was way under cooked, like chewing on a rubber band. I cut into my beef Wellington and it was raw, not rare, not blue, but raw... (I like my steak medium rare, my wife, she likes her steak rare). I sent it back, which I almost never do. I went to culinary school, and was a Chef for nearly 20 years, and hate being a pain by sending dishes back. The mashed potatoes that accompanied it was way too salty, like punch you in the face salty. When they brought it back, I cut into it, and the meat was still undercooked. Instead I ended up getting a 7oz filet mignon (which I took home, and was just ok), but by then I lost my appetite and just wanted to go home. The saving grace of our whole experience was Matt, he was very professional and polite.

Staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant.  Great atmosphere.  The food was amazing.  I love this place.  My wife and I have been a few times and everything on the menu is a great choice.  Good job guys!
Food is always great at the Brickyard, And you can actually talk to each other and hear each other , it's just really nice.
Excellent always!
The food was okay waitress was a little on the rude side the atmosphere is great

I can't say thank you enough for the more than accomodating service and exceptional food we got tonight!  So very thankful I came across this restaurant on our quick overnight in Boise.  We were desperate for a meal, and several other restaurants turned us down, because it was too close to 8pm.  The Brickyard was MORE than happy to help us, and we had outstanding food in record time.  This restaurant definitely knows the secret to survival during these very difficult business times.  I look forward to dining in, someday in the (hopefully near) future.  The grilled cheese salad will definitely stick in my culinary memory bank!!
Our favorite restaurant in Boise; ask for Johnathan We miss y’all

This place is amazing. Please do try any of their steaks and you will thank me. Service was second to none. They offer table side salad and have great selection of wines. If you are thinking about a good place to eat I decided for you.

We dined on a Friday night. The gentleman playing the piano was wonderful and added to our experience. Andrea, our waitress was fantastic and gracious with our questions. The french onion soup, salad with huckleberry vinaigrette, salmon, filet minion, and huckleberry cobbler were all amazing! We will definitely be going back!
A beautiful lady fed me shrooms, no idea what the food tastes like but the lights where great
Great atmosphere, good food

Great food and amazing service. The waiter was very friendly and the atmosphere of the restaurant is superb. The evening was topped off with music from dueling piano players. I highly recommend this restaurant and will be going back soon.
Johnathan was an amazing server. Food was great, atmosphere was great, and service was exceptional. Definitely will visit this restaurant again.
Fantastic food and service.
Nice atmosphere and good food, dueling pianos... Went for our in-laws' anniversary. Wait staff very good...
Nice place to go for a fancy lunch.
Excellent food, service and ambiance. Surpassed my expectations for a special occasion dinner.
Went for valentines day and the whole experience was wonderful. The food was excellent and the staff was very friendly. They gave as muffins to take home and they were delicious.
Wonderful dinner, everytime. Waiter at our most recent visit, Rene, was on point and perfect.  GM Mike was so friendly and accommodating.  We made our next reservation before leaving for the evening.

Was able to go to the Brickyard for Valentines Day 2020 and it was a really wonderful experience. The special, while rather expensive, was a creative and interesting meal that was truly fantastic. The staff was friendly, welcoming, and really added to the overall experience. The live music was the perfect volume and created a ambiance and atmosphere that made the evening very special.
Cool place!
Very nice atmosphere. Food was delicious!
Never had their food, but if you're looking for a fun time, I highly recommend the Dueling Pianos. So much fun!

WOW! This was seriously one of the best meals my husband and I had in a long time. We went for our wedding anniversary and our server greeted us with a happy anniversary wish as soon as we sat down. Our steaks were cooked perfectly and the table side salad service was a fun touch. We will definitely be going back for another date night!
We had a fabulous dining experience at The Brickyard recently. Excellent food — delicious steak —- service and ambiance.  Highly recommend!
Nice cozy place for date night.  Food was great. Friendly staff.

The wait staff is excellent, attentive to their diners.  The food is wonderful - my petit filet was grilled to perfection.  The atmosphere exudes elegance, and the live piano music adds to the ambiance.  Will definitely return!
Delicious- perfect for a date night!

Excellant food, good atmosphere, the servers are friendly, we had a very significant issue with our bill, I booked for company party, each guest had 2 drink tickets, several had a separate drink that I noticed being paid, when I got the final bill there was 20+ additional drinks that we not ours, I immediately called the manager who immediately said that It would be my responsibility to fund who had the drinks and get them to pay for it... hhhmm excuse me!!!! I had to wait 2 days for a day manager, who I got the feeling was really tired and I did not want to deal with it. So the reluctantly credited back an average price for 21 drinks. BUT, this was a party of 26 which means automatic percentage for tip and tax, so I feel the bill was still over charged by about 200 dollars, so enjoy the food and atmosphere but pay very close attention to your tab. To much work We will not be re visiting this establishment.

Advertised as a dueling piano venue but we got on a Friday night from 7-9 was some guy pretending  to play along to a midi grand piano. Nice, expensive cuts of meats were poorly prepared. I ordered the Beef Wellington. It seemed to have been prepared ahead of time, frozen, then defrosted. The center of the meat was still icy. The pastry surrounding the beef was store bought puff pastry. The meal might have been worth the price IF there was entertainment, but there wasn't. If you're looking for great steak in Boise, there are at least 10 other establishments who do it better than The Brickyard.

Came last winter to celebrate our friend’s birthday, but came too early in the evening and missed the dueling  pianos. The food was great and came in a reasonable amount of time. Great downtown location close to other venues and city hall. We will definitely return.
Had dinner tonight at brickyard. It was great. We will be back. Our waiter was really good.
Dueling pianos is the absolute best!!!!

The staff, incredible. The atmosphere, impeccable. The drinks, creative and delishious. The food, just ok. Granted we were there on Christmas Eve, so they were crazy busy. But the food felt rushed and a little bland, especially for the price. 4 stars because of the amazing wait staff, otherwise would have been 3.
Nice banquet.
Service was great. Steak was perfect. Yummy blueberry cheesecake dessert!

Reservation with ease through yelp. Brickyard has a 5 star team that really made for a fun and memorable experience. Beef Wellington, NY and Truffle fries were amazing. Our party’s drinks from looked amazing, even the Ice! Very thoughtful to send us home with cranberry muffins at the end of our night.

The brick yard is a wonderful resteraunt with a great atmosphere.  The food here is delicious and well prepared.  They also have a rolling salad bar where they make your salads right next to the table which is all part of the experience.  They had live piano music playing in the background throughout dinner and it really added to the ambiance of the resteraunt.  They also do dueling pianos which can be a blast. All in all, I would highly recommend the brickyard to anyone looking for a nice evening in downtown Boise

We arrived at the Brickhouse on Christmas Eve @5pm the server was amazing but... for a high end restaurant and the prices of food I am only giving this place two stars because the server was great. The food was just ok.. steaks had no flavor and for the price I expected amazing. The choice of potato was a bit off, I was told the truffle fries were amazing but not sure where the truffle was. It was not on the fries. As a matter of fact there was nothing on my fries. The food was less compared to the long horn, but we wanted chandlers. We waited over two hours for our food to come out. Yes over two hours. Some of us in our party ordered dessert which took another 30-40 min for a cookie and a cobbler.  Some got the mash potato and they again were just ok. The restaurant was not overly packed and could not find a reason why food took so long but I don’t think time should alter the flavor of the food. This was our Christmas Eve experience and by the accounts and the other reviews I would say we experienced what others have as well with the price of food to quality of food. It’s a nice place to sit in and the servers are pleasant but the food was not equal to the price and to us was really just ehhh ok!
Loved it! The food was so tasty, melt in my mouth flavor. Semi formal atmosphere and dueling pianos! We will be back.

The Brickyard was good. I'm not used to that fancy a place or paying that much but the food and service was all great. Very memorable. If there was anything to gripe about maybe it was the rolling salad bar. U couldn't see any of the items being offered and it sort of became a more of a memory test of what the Salad Chef was saying. His tip jar was the only thing that was on clear display. Kind of tacky.
Best filet I've had in Boise. Great service.
Great Food Great Service!

We have ALWAYS had a wonderful experience at The Brickyard. Great food; even better service, and a terrific atmosphere in an historic location of Old Boise. (Located at 601 W. Main St in the Original Statesman bldg.) I highly suggest the Dueling Piano show on Friday night!
Fantastic restaurant... the Beef Wellington is amazing. Make sure to ask for Johnathan for amazing service.
Wonderful selections.

We ate here this past Friday. The piano playing in the background was very relaxing. The atmosphere is nice and feels fancy. The food in my opinion is not worth the price. I had crab dip w/ bread it wasn't anything extraordinary. The baked brie was alright it did come with more fruit than I expected! Tbh the two cocktails I had were TERRIBLE. Don't get me wrong they were strong  I could taste the Vodka. One of the cocktails (can't recall the name) tasted like Pez. The 10 oz steak was good and my husband loved his elk. BUT the salad was SO SMALL if that is going to be one of my sides you'd think it would be larger and it was limp romaine lettuce it wasn't spring mix. And the other sides are all potatoes which are quite cheap and they didn't taste good (we had mashed, and au gratin). The service was fantastic very attentive and kind waiter, very conversational and attentive. They do give you sorbet to "cleanse your palette" which is neat but the food isn't terrible it is I would say a little above average but not worth $200 for dinner.

Yesterday I went to this place, the service was outstanding but when it came to my steak it went wrong. I ordered my steak medium but I recieved my steak well done. I told them that the steak was not medium and they replaced the steak only to recieve a raw steak. If I have to tell them to fix a steak a third time it's a no go. So I told them it was okay and packed it up only to cook it more on boil at home. I had to had spices and cook it over. Servicer was great but I well never order a steak from here ever again. Thank you.
Food very good and nice atmosphere.

I found this establishment online was in town visiting but definitely not a go back to restaurants. When I first got there the hostess said there no table available 1st bad interaction then, I asked can I sit at the bar she hesitated then said yes mean she now had to clean a section of the bar then I seen there was a table behind me free just needed to also be clear so I asked the man at the bar and he was happy to get that done I Ordered the lamb dinner took 40min to come out then to have plastic in my cold mashed potatoes was awful the waiter  offered me a free dessert I was just ready to go and said no thank you  and paid my full bill

Very nice place. It is classy and they have dueling pianos on the weekend. They push a cart around with salad and toppings in it and make it right there for you. Bartenders are amazing, making innovative delicious drinks. Food is top notch and always fresh. Great date night or lunch place! Happy hour is great!!

Last night in Boise with my girl and what a disaster at The Brickyard.  Smooth until my 10 ounce Filet ordered medium rare arrived medium plus.  The manager came to the table and was going to have a new steak prepared and said go ahed and eat your vegetables and potato ( ? ).  No doing and I requested a new dinner entree.  Mean time my girl was uncomfortably eating her entree while I waited.  At 20 minutes, I summoned our waiter and said done - bring me the check.  The manager arrived and ask what is the problem...  Need I say more.  How can an establishment specializing in steak allow this to happen.  Now sure but we won't be back. The manager did bring two boxed up dinners - my wife's and mine new entree which I left with the piano player and my wife o the table..
Great food and drinks. Amazing ambience and waitstaff. Perfect for a nice steak dinner out. Classy for Boise.
Salmon!!!!! Great service as well! Little spend but worth it.

Ok so I have to preface this by saying I have a cracked rib and havent been able to eat much in the last 5 days, however....OMG this place is fantastic. I had a manhattan, onion soup, truffle fries and a ribeye with demi glace added. So lets start with the drink... my bartender, Matt fixed my manhattan as special ordered. Ignore the drink menu as they have liquor brands not mentioned. Then the soup arrived. I can honestly say it is the first cup of onion soup that I have finished in YEARS. Wonderful veal stock with the perfect amount of sweetness from the onions, which I suspect are vidalias. The steak then arrived that was so perfectly  flavorful and juicy. Hats off to the 5 star brickyard. I will be back.
The service was awesome.  Food melts in your mouth.

Best high end steak and seafood in Boise.  Staff is very professional, warm and friendly.  Large portions.  Appetizers are terrific.  Cocktails have generous portions of alcohol.  Don't ever feel rushed.  Pleasant, good traditional steak house environment with Piano bar.  Will definitely return.
drinks were great. food was amazing. service was on point kept our drinks filled were very friendly took an uber to location. was a bit of a wait on our food but worth it. will definitely come back.
Great steak and table made salad. The pianos ad a touch of class.
Everything was great! From the cocktails, appetizer, salad, entrees, it all tasted great. The service was great and relaxed
Excellent from start to finish! Service was superb, food was amazing (peanut butter mashed potatoes were so so good). Not one complaint!!
By the time we got there I was deaf in one ear and could not hear out of the other but t seemed like a fun place.  Food was great
My wife and I had dinner here last night and we were very impressed with the staff along with the piano playing lightly in the background and the food was amazing!!
Dueling pianos was fantastic! Love the vibe of this place! If you have never been I highly reccomend it!
Great atmosphere, solid service and amazing food! The bar is really nice too.
Great restaurant, great service
Nice place, high quality staff. Food is par on 4 plus stars
Worth the money. Some of the best food in Boise. And the live piano is great
Great bar with food that is A+
Service totally inadequate... never been here before but a definite turn off. Dueling pianos on point. Service blows. Can't speak to the food. Define it in one word? Pretentious.
Had a blast .... first  time to experience  the dueling  pianos... the drummer was awesome!
Great bar, but the people make the place
Terrific, friendly service.
I had some issues with the staff, but the owner reached out to me and worked with me to deal with it. Because of him, I will keep going back. Thank you Andy
Strong drinks, 3 guys playing piano, everyone singing along!  What more could you want?!?
Good food and great beverages
Great food...upgrade the bourbon lineup  and you have a home run!  Not bad but the quality of the steaks should be matched by the quality of the bar!
OUTSTANDING!  Wish I could give 6 stars!
Best lunch special in town, by far. Also, best steak house in this price range. Easily as good as the more expensive places. Great service.
Cool setting. Superb service. Outstanding entree's.
Service was good and the chicken salad special was delicious.
Fantastic experience and wonderful food. Very accommodating with vegetarian options for my wife.
Great!

I would never recommend this place to anyone. We had a party of 2. The gentleman at the front told us that he was going to go see if there was a table ready and left us standing at the front for 15+ minutes! Didn't get a chance to order because we turned around and walked out. TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!

Made an easy reservation online, showed up early and they seated us no problem and showered us with awesomeness from then on.. we stayed for the Dualing Pianos after dinner and it was incredible. Keep doing what you are doing Brickyard!
Loved our experience. The food was delicious. The lemon drop martini was divine. Service was superb and loved the live piano music.
Great customer service. Loved the amenities that they provided - breakfast muffins were a wonderful treat!
Only went for drinks. Nice bar and friendly staff.
Try the bloody mary!
Mimosas had tang instead of fresh squeezed o.j. waiter said we were wrong. I'm 63. I know fresh squeezed o.j.
Yummy Easter Brunch
BEST in Boise.  Treat YOURSELF to world class service.
Excellent service and food.
Great food

I don't normally go out to steakhouses for a night out with my future husband, but this was probably the best steakhouse I have gone to so far! The staff was very nice, the woman who made my tableside salad was so kind when I had no clue what was going on as well. Steak was cooked perfectly and my mashed potatoes were so creamy and delicious (NEED that recipe!). Plus the best part is that it was an inexpensive-expensive dinner. Going to Vic Stewart's Steakhouse we spent over $120 dollars (if memory serves me right), here at The Brickyard, it was around $85 or $90 including the tip! We had our soup and salad, a palette cleanser of lemon sorbet before the main event of steak, mashed potatoes, and vegetables. Then with my meal, it included a dessert (I chose the huckleberry cobbler). 10/10 would definitely go again for a night out on the town.
Great place will definitely go back

Best meal ever. The onion soup was amazing, the elk tenderloins were delicious, I had to order a second slice of cheesecake too take home cause it was so good. Excellent service also, the food justifies the cost.
Had reservations  and waited a hour and a half !! And if your a blue collar worker like me. .... your best to go eat at Olive garden.  More food for a better price.!!!

Delicious food on the pricey side. Went there on a Wednesday on time for a reservation and still had to wait for a table. We were there at 6 to eat before an event at 8. By 7:50 we were scrambling for the bill, passing on dessert, and getting our leftovers boxed since everything took forever to arrive. Pass on the French onion soup. The peanut butter mashed potatoes were a hit. Nothing but good things to say about the steaks.
Very good food with amazing service!
GREAAAAAAT food, GREAAAAAAT servers, GREAAAAAAT entertainment with the Dueling Piano players and drummer...HIGHLY recommended!!!

Our server was incredibly attentive without being overwhelming. He was polite, professional, and pleasant. We had an incredible dining experience last night. It was my first time having dinner at the Brickyard and I can honestly say that the service far outweighs their very reasonable prices for a fine dining experience. The Brie, Ribeye, and delicious truffle fries were worth every penny. Additionally, that Green Goddess salad dressing is music to my taste buds. However, your staff is most certainly where the value is. Thank you!

Overall a very disappointing experience.  Applebees has a better grasp on serving etiquette than the staff at the Brickyard.  The water/bread server was inept, and extremely rude (he even volunteered his political opinion to us in an attempt at a backhanded insult).  I thought it was odd for a low level server to have an attitude. Then, we met the frontend manager, and it all made sense.  This place has serious top down problems, and it's reflected in the quality service.  To go on, we had reservations, and were sat next to the bathroom.  We did switch tables when a better one became available.  The staff failed to clean our new table, and then sat our silverware on the dirty surface.  The bread wasn't brought to out table till we had been there an hour.  The server didn't bring bread plates, and opted to just toss the bread on our entree plates (entree arrived before the bread...).  The food was okay, but for the money I had higher expectations.  One of our entrees was overdone, and burnt.  Really, an item shouldn't be on the menu if it can't be prepared properly.  There were issues with the drinks as well.  Most bartenders can mix a dirty martini w/o special instructions, not at the Brickyard apparently.  I could go on, but hopefully this is enough to give people an idea of what to expect.  I don't recommend the Brickyard, especially if you're trying to celebrate a special occasion. I won't be returning unless I really want to ruin a night out.
Best steak and service in town
Food is good but way overpriced for what it is. Spent 3 hours there.. took 30 minutes to get a beer from our waiter and got food an hour later.
great atmosphere. steak done to perfection.
Really good, went there and had a three course meal, excellent soups (speaking as someone who hates soup), and awesome steaks.

Family get-together was a huge success thanks to Jonathan our waiter and all of the support staff.  Wine was excellent and food great.  Conversation was lively and Jonathan became a helpful and joyous addition to the family fun.

We were served prawns that had clearly spoiled and the only compensation we received was complimentary breakfast muffins instead of a discount on the meal.  This was my first experience with this restaurant and I won’t be returning.
Great energy and atmosphere.  Would highly recommend.
Top notch. Ribeye was fantastic! Jonathan was an exceptional server, too.

I went for dueling pianos and they are fantastic! I like listening to Adam on Drums, Jason and Danny on Keys/Piano and I would recommend to go there on Friday and Saturday nights when they are playing. There is a small dance space around where they play where people dance. All songs are on requests so that is fun! Atmosphere is great!

Food was good and waiters were good. Dueling piano performance was terrible. As in a piano rendition of Eminem's Without Me. Wouldn't recommend the entertainment here. If you want to hear every drunk girls favorite annoying song on the piano go here.
We went to the brick yard just for the halibut...snicker!
Went there for a few drinks and dueling pianos, had a great time.
The dueling pianos are very entertaining
Very good meal with wine pairing.  Staff did a wonderful job of describing the pairings and keeping the event moving smoothly.  Excellent service.
Superb service and great food!

Beyond disappointed. This was only my second time eating at the Brickyard. The 1st time, my steak was amazing, the service was amazing (blonde woman with a "jalapeno" tattooed on her throat 😋). Unfortunately the second time was awful, and I will not be going back. The main problem was the food, I ordered a fillet mignon, medium rare, not only did it take forever to come out (apparently they can't have a large party, and a full dining room and deliver decent service). When my food finally call out, my steak was cold, tough, and dry. When the waiter came by to check, I explained. He sent the manager over, who didn't say two words except "pardon my reach" to my husband, grabbed my steak with tongs, squeezed it, put it back on my plate, and said he'd go take care of it. I thought I would get a new properly cooked fillet, because clearly mine was not cooked right. If a medium rare fillet mignon is not buttery, "melt in your mouth" it wasn't cooked correct. All I got back was the same steak heated up. It was almost impossible to even cut the steak. Very disappointed. And I won't even mention desert.... Will not be going back, I'll spend $43 on a properly cooked fillet somewhere else!!!
Foods is amazing and the hospitality / customer service is some of the best. Everything is price right, felt everything was worth the price. Great wine and cocktails too
Great food, great service!
Very intimate old school steakhouse.  The food and service was impressive. Highlights were the French onion soup and the steak both were amazing.
Great place with amazing food and a grat place to have a good night out with friends! Go after 10pm Friday and Saturday to hear some amazing and entertaining music during the Dueling pianos!!!
Good food and environment!
Loved the dueling pianos
Great happy hour, atmosphere and service.
Delicious food and spirited drinks. Great service and atmosphere. Favorite part of the experience was Andy Clements!
Loved their happy hour! Great variety of tasters and their drink menu is fantastic. Beer, wine, and clever cocktails. Great vibe!
Amazing food
This is a hidden gem in Boise
Little pricey but excellent food and drinks, and wonderful dueling pianos late in the evening!

Had several courses. Enjoyed the crab stuffed mushrooms, Yukon Golden Potatoe Soup, the 28 oz Bone in Ribeye with scalloped potatoes and an Arnold Palmer and what I believe they called Still Water (I imagine it was filtered tap water, chilled.) The ribeye was probably the best I've tasted. It had a very flavorful buttery taste to it. The meat was tender. Nice presentation served on a mound of sauteed mushrooms, asparagus spears and organic carrots. Scalloped potatoes were different. It looked like tiramisu when they first brought it out. Soup was also very good. Service was perfect. They didn't aggravate me and would check on me when my beverage was low otherwise only to bring the food. They provided a small sorbet to cleanse the palate between the starters and the main course. I'll be back for sure.
Pricey but you get the best food, atmosphere,  and service around.
Good food but very busy
Great filet mignon! Cooked right n tasty!

We had a good dinner. My sister's potatoes were cold. The carrots and asparagus were hard to cut. But other than that the dinner was good. The entertainment was excellent ♡♡♡♡♡ Nye is always kind of crazy!!
Nice place, good environment. Very classy. Can't beat the happy hour drink prices

Made reservations 2 weeks in advance for new years eve. It took over 2 hours to get our appetizers and starters. 3 hours to get our entrees. We remained patient but many people around us cancelled orders and left. Food was decent but there is obviously a problem in the kitchen. If we were not in a group of people we would have left.
Simply the best!
Their lunch special is amazing for$9
You can always count on getting a good cut of meat. Paired with one of their potato sides and their table side salad you won't find a better meal in town.

We had an amazing meal last night. First time at The Brickyard and there were so many special touches. I don't want to spoil those surprises, but I will recommend the tableside salad service. Most importantly, our steaks were exactly the temperature we ordered. Service was attentive. Ambiance galore. We WILL be coming back. Thanks for an awesome holiday meal before hitting up Winter Garden Aglow.
We love coming here for dueling pianos. Really fun and usually a great crowd. Drinks are a little pricey
High end low priced lunch specials . Friendly service.
Great food and atmosphere
Amazing courteous staff, wonderful food, spectacular ambiance, would definitely go back.
Great food and great service

Dueling pianist where great. Had an awesome sense of humor when I requested ridiculous songs, such as all about that bass and I kissed a girl. ( both were male) the drummer made it just that much more great! My only complaint is there is no room to dance and they closed way to early.
Love this place!
Great steaks and the tableside salad was perfect.

So much for a great B'Day evening with my Wife! After the fine window table seating, a great atmosphere and superb drinks, our dinner arrived very late. My rib-eye steak was grisly, lukewarm and the sides were cold. My Wife's rib-eye was OK, but not on par. The table-side salad service was clever and our waiter was cordial. After downing our Cabernet, both while waiting for our tardy dinners and afterwards, we settled for comping my dinner. As my Wife lost her appetite by then and I don't like eating alone and after the fact, we just went home...sans a desert celebration! Obviously, the Brickyard's kitchen and wait-staff had a problem, at least with our meal, last night. Having dined at some of the finest steakhouses across the country and based on the billing this restaurant proffers, offering a do-over or comp, doesn't bode well for cultivating repeat customers.
Just  was amazing staff and service was great
Excellent food, service, and environment!
Food was really good in the service was excellent I really like the Dueling Pianos
Best restaraunt in Boise. Service, food and atmosphere was awesome!
Best salad ever! Great service and attention to detail for the whole meal! Love the breakfast muffins! ❤
Good food, love the dueling pianos!
Great place for quiet business meetings
Amazing :)
Our favorite place for an upscale dinner. Food great, service attentive and friendly, and the piano player is awesome.
Live the lamb chops there ..Live music, wine and lamb chops make a perfect dining experience
Good food. Good customer service.

If i could give this place 6 stars, i would. First the service is terrific. Second, the drinks are excellent and obvioisly made by someone who knows what he or she is doing. Third, the steaks are simply fantastic. No two ways about it. They come with a great salad prepared table side, a choice of potato, fresh bread, and wild mushrooms. Oh and vegetables. Dessert is extra but also fantastic. The wine list is a little thin and a bit expensive but there are some surprisingly good Idaho wines especially the Cabs. Didnt see any parking close by. But restaurant on a corner of Main and 6th so easy to find. By the way, on weekend nights they have dueling pianos! Make a reservation and enjoy.
Off the hook food! It's an experience!!

Not greeted with any importance. Waiter never showed up after 15 minutes of being sat down. It was my wife's birthday and we walked out of the place. Totally pointless of a place especially in proximity of much better proven places.
Great service, and staff! Prompt on food orders, and superb pours, check it out!

My husband took us here for our Anniversary,  It was absolutely perfect.  Food is amazing. Servers are super friendly, very welcoming.  Oh and the salad is the BEST! Def. Reccomend this place for sure.

Ww couldn't have asked for a better anniversary dinner.  Great food, fantastic service and a wonderful atmosphere. My husband's steak was cooked perfectly. My seafood risotto was a little salty, but everything else was amazing. And the best part was that it was very reasonably priced.
Great happy hour drinks
We have been there numerous times. The food and service have always been great. Highly recommended!

Amazing service. A steak, 2 potatoes, Brie cheese with berries and bread, a huckleberry cobbler a la mode, mango sorbet, and two breakfast muffins for $60! Amazing service, delightful piano player, and a romantic ambience. Will definitely go here again!

Drinks and Show! I have been here twice and I would say your experience really depends on who is playing that night. The first time we went there was a great experience and we had a blast. The piano players and drummer had great chemistry made us laugh, played awesome songs and left us wanting to come back with all our friends. The next time we came back was entertaining but just alright. Drinks are really good and the staff is very friendly.

This place sucks. I have been here 4 times and all but one was not worth the price.  At happy hour you are treated like second class citizens,  you dont even get a table cloth.  When the server finds out you only want drink or appetizers,  they disappear for 30 min.  We had made a reservation to watch the dueling pianos, but this must be code to get treated like sh%# . We did not even get water or menus.  No one checked on us so we left. Also the piano playing is nice but the guy who plays it is a creep. My advice, spend your money elsewhere.
Dueling pianos are the bee's knees!
Always memorable.  They do a good job.
awesome place
Excellent food and service!
Just had dinner their for my wife's birthday, the food was amazing, loved the atmosphere and Garret and also Justin were fantastic. Can't wait to go back. Worth every penny.

We went to this place last night and it was pretty bad.  Service was on the slow side, but the real problem was the food.  The food took for ever to come out of the kitchen and for the most not very good.  Fingerling potatoes were cooked on the outside and hard as a rock on the inside.  We never did get the sides that we ordered.  The final blow was the 20% gratuity that was added to the bill.  Perhaps I should have protested but we were anxious to get going since we had been sitting there for 3 hours.
Great food and amazing service.
Delicious
Strange but good menus

I came here for my bachelorette party on Saturday. Well, it was a huge surprise for me as my maids of honors had reservations at a specific time that was confirmed with an employee here. When we entered inside the restaurant we had multiple servers questioning our reservations & that they we not aware of it. They seemed a little annoyed about it, as if we were bombarding/invading there convenience. They made the room for our reservation set up for our event after waiting by the bar for a few minutes, it was a little awkward. We had ordered a steak and salmon. Well let me just tell you about how fine cooking this entree was... the steak was supposed to be medium/well done & as I was cutting through the steak nothing but blood was gushing out of the meat. It was disgusting. We had our waitress take it back to cook it to where there was only supposed to be a little pink inside & when they brought it back it was still bleeding a lot & the pink was still pretty raw, after already asking to take the steak back to cook it to how it's initially supposed to be we didn't eat anymore of it. I only had taken two bites from this steak & the taste was so blan it reminded me of hamburger helper meat! Horrible quality! The asparagus was also so under cooked, and I cook asparagus at my house it was way too raw! The salmon was so raw too, the girls only ate the outside of the meat that was reasonably cooked, it was poorly cooked!!! At the end of this the waitress seemed passive aggressive with us and honestly it wasn't professional at all. I'm sorry but I would not recommend this place to ANYONE! I will be telling all of my friends, family, and employees about this place! Horrible quality, Horrible service!
Fabulous...menu and service.

The three stars come from great customer service. They'd get a solid 5 stars if the prices of the food matched the product that you get served. Unfortunately, for what you're paying, the steaks are a little bland. Not nearly as tender as they should be for the price. Go there expecting great service in a classy environment but expect to pay for it.
The lunch special is almost always tasty and affordable.

My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at The Brickyard and were pleasantly surprised by the excellent food and exceptional service.  The prices were on the high end but to be expected.  The quality and amount of food was terrific, with multiple "courses".  We had to get a box to take it home.  The environment and staff were great, attentive but not hovering and pleasant to talk with.  Jonathan did a superb job!  We will definitely be back!!

Did was great, service was okay, it just took forever to get our order and even have our order taken. I also thought the salad making cart they have takes far to long for large parties. I would have rather just ordered a side salad that had a set amount of toppings and a choice if dressing.
Great food, relaxed atmosphere.
Incredible service and the food newyork steak is cooked to perfection
Piano bar was awesome! They play off each other so well. Our server went out of her way to get us a great table, right up front.
Very entertaining and very good service from the waiters and waitresses I would go back anytime I would recommend going to this place
One of the nicer, more quaint steakhouses here in Boise. The food is always too notch. A bit on the spendy side, but worth it for the atmosphere. Will go again I'm sure.
First time going here and it was for my Birthday. The food was excellent and I got a dessert of my choice on the house and a piano song was played for me as well.

I went into this restaurant so excited because I love trying out new places and it was my birthday! The servers were great from the get go, checking in with our first initial orders but then we got 30 minutes in and our server told us the wait time for their salad preparer was going to be a bit, we ended up sitting there an hour and a half before we saw our main course. I understand having multi-course meals it can take some time for meals to arrive but having to wait for our food to be fired until we had our salad unacceptable. BUT Brickyard did a wonderful job at making sure they made up for that! They took care of our meal and went beyond that! I deeply appreciate the fact that they made sure we’d return for a better experience. As a supervisor of a restaurant myself I expect the best of not only our restaurant but of others of equal or more quality! Thank you for taking better care of us! We will definitely be back and we will be looking forward to your known best service.
We went here for Mother's Day brunch.  The food was very good but the service was below average.
An excellent place for lunch where you can talk and be heard.  The food is terrific too.
Delicious food. Very nice place to eat!!!!
Good experience the whole way around.
Love the atmosphere love the food overall awesome experience will be there again

Such an amazing dinner experience. Dwelling piano's to dance and sing along to, those were fun. I had the beef wellington, which had a little to much garlic for my taste but it was still so delicious. My boyfriend and I had pretty much had steak for our meals, they were cooked perfectly. The sommelier gave us a very good recommendation for wine. The huckleberry dressing for the salad was heaven, they need to bottle that and sell it!  The huckleberry cobbler was to die for!!! Couldnt have asked for a more perfect place for a date night. Highly recommend to everyone!
Awesome place with good service and a piano bar. Awesome people!

We had a family gathering at the Brickyard in their private room on a  Saturday.  Our group included four children, one baby and sixteen adults. The table setting was beautiful, the service was superior and the food was outstanding.  Every person connected to the service of our party was cordial, helpful and efficient.  Thank you to the Brickyard for making our gathering a day to remember.

Service was flawless. To start my water never went below half full if you asked for anything it was at you table within a minute. They make your salad at your table adding only what you want, I recommend their huckleberry vinaigrette. The ribeye was delicious and yes it's possible to eat a dinner for 2 both be full and leave with under $100.00 fine dining tab.

We went for my wife's birthday around 12:30. Thinking it would be crowded, we were surprised to find only 6 or so tables taken. We took 2 hours to leisurely go through our drinks and food. A couple of house martinis to start. Then We went with delicious crab cakes, then the mac and cheese (my wife said, "This is the best I've ever had!"), a brickyard burger....amazing, truffle fries and ice cream for desert. Rene was our server and he was fabulous. Patient, friendly, not imposing. We had the place to ourselves the last hour. We will definitely go here again.

Great restaurant, the food was superb and the staff was phenomenal and very friendly. The food had layers of flavor and texture that added to the experience. The staff was fun and easy to talk to and always willing to give recommendations when requested. The dueling pianos were fantastic and we're able to play every song requested with a tremendous energy and we're great showman. A hair on the spendy side but worth every penny, I would recommend it to anyone looking to celebrate a special occasion.
Brickyard has delicious food, great atmosphere and friendly staff! One of my favorite places to eat and hangout in Boise especially on the weeknd’s when they have the dueling pianos.
I would recommend the Brickyard to all of my friends! The atmosphere is always fun! Will definitely be going back soon.
One of the most fun places in Boise to eat!

This is an excellence upscale restaurant in Boise. The presentation is elegant. The table side salad preparations were done by Kenny, he was very professional and made our evening very enjoyable. The food was delicious, there is planty of food. It does take your evening to go through all the courses.  They had live piano playing starting around 6:30/7 pm.
Best filet mignon I can remember while hearing incredible live piano music.

Perfect! Service was flawless,food was excellent and great atmosphere.  Only suggestion is to create a way to dim the light from the street light just outside. Perhaps add some shade to the transome windows. Very annoying  as it catches your eye and is very bright.

Our waiter Johnathan made the whole experience.  It was the first time there, and he was so kind, very intelligent on the menu, and had great recommendations. I would go back just for his service, attitude and friendly/kind smile.  The food was AMAZING.  I had the halibut for dinner, had a salad with my meal (The whole salad bar thing on the cart --- that is odd not gonna lie.  I'd rather just have the choice of different salads but eh, what do you do.) Had the crab dip for an appetizer and that was incredible.  Prefect blends in there.  Expensive, yes.  Worth it to go back? Hell yes.  Also had some great bartenders, and drinks were good.

Went there with my wife never been there before. The waiter was awesome no complaints there, the food for being an upscale steak house was bad. My wife ordered the lamb and mashed potatoes and it came out cold and raw. She ordered it medium. I ordered the beef wellington with mushrooms and it came out cold and the mushrooms were rubbery. We complained to the waiter and he brought over the manager all she did was comp a 8$ drink. Didn't apologize or anything. I definitely will not be coming back. Lot better steak houses in Boise for the same price.
Our favorite restaurant in Boise!
Best steak in Boise! Try the peanut butter mashed potatoes.

This restaurant has wonderful deco, with classic BIG band music playing lightly enough to block near by but not interfere with table discussions. They have good list of drink offrrings. The food was perfectly prepared and amazingly satisfying.
Easily the best steaks in town! The food and service is wonderful we will definently be back!

Was in last night for dinner. I was early for my reservation and decided to sit at the bar for a drink. No bartender. No acknowledgment that I was waiting for a drink. I went to the hostess and asked to just be seated. I sat at my table for 12 minutes before the waiter showed up. Nice guy, but 12 minutes for an "upscale" restaurant is too long. When my date showed up we ordered the crab cakes, which were delicious. Then our entrees. I had the bone out ribeye and she had the petite sirloin. We both ordered our steaks medium rare. They came to us medium well, borderline well done. Upon informing our waiter he offered to have new steaks cooked for us. We accepted. Then some lady showed up and said we would get a drink comped for our troubles. When the new steaks arrived hers was medium and mine was rare. Obviously the head chef was not in the kitchen and whomever was cooking these steaks really had no idea what he was doing. I won't be returning to the Brickyard. Not when I can get better service and better steak elsewhere for cheaper.
Great drinks and yummy food.

The two salmon dishes were seriously undercooked, the food in general was fairly bland.  I would expect more out of a 100 meal per couple.  Service was not over the top but good, but when we complained about the undercooked fish, we were given a dessert which was not compensatory to the problem at hand.  We were told a manager would come talk to us and it never happened.  We probably won't return.
Superb service and great food!  Try the peanut butter potatoes if they're still on the menu.  There was live piano music and when you stay later they have dueling pianos.

Best stop of our 8 day 2000 mile trip.  Service was perfect from first glass of water to nice touch of bringing a bag of blueberry muffins for breakfast after paying check  Steaks were awesome and as you would hope and expect in Idaho all variations of potatoes from soup to baked, mashed , fries and peanut butter mashed were spectacular!  A+ stop if you are looking for a nice dinner.
Love it! Dueling pianos! Great service and delicious food and amazing drinks!!!
Great food and service. Love the atmosphere too. They don't disappoint. Reservations rarely seem required but I would still recommend them.
This is a very fun place!
Nice place
Cozy vibe and a warm atmosphere. This classy steak restaurant is perfect for all occasions. No complaints about the food at all. Friendly and professional staff.
Really good sandwiches, and some decent salad offerings
Have used the larger room for groups of 20 plus several times.   The food,  the service,  and accommodations are always very good.   Will continue our tradition of hosting our dinners there

I travel a lot, from coast to coast on an almost regular basis and roughly a third if the time I eat my evening meal alone. I've taught myself to seek out the places that are just "a little more crowded" than the places that are secluded and quiet. There is something about a certain amount of buzz in the air that makes a meals alone, a little bit more entertaining. So that's why I've found myself here. I've been to the Eagle, ID location and now this one in downtown Boise. I find this one just a very little bit better. Eagle is much more suburban almost rural and the crowd is a little more,how shall I say "passed young"... But so am I. The food is pretty good and normal American fare type stuff. Great selection of beer, booze, and wine. The one thing I don't "get" in this location is the high/low table set up. It's awkward at best as most of the high tables get really larger groups who squeeze in tight, college crowds and alike. The elevated stools reduce the "ass to head" distance when a low table is wedged in between two high tables. It's just not right at some level...get it "level" Don't get me wrong. These are good places and I always enjoy my time here... Depending which way I face!
Amazing filet mignon and salmon. Their medium-well was as tender as other place's medium-rare. Seriously.

Went on a weeknight for a 'date night'. Way overpriced! On a scale of 1-10, our Ribeyes were a 4...tough and little flavor. No good vegetable substitutions for the potato offered with the entre...it was brocollini or brocollini with carrots. Salad was great. Live piano was beautiful. This place is just outrageously overpriced...$100 spent on dinner...with only an entre each and water only to drink! We'll be sticking with Texas Roadhouse for a good steak. Sorry.
Very pricy

We went there for lunch and  ordered drinks to start off with and it took about 15 minutes to get them.$6for a well drink and $10 each for a cheap house glass of wine.There was only about 10 or 12 people in the place.  Crab cakes were good, but the size of a silver dollar for four dollars a piece.  French onion soup was the worst we have had in Boise. it was so sugary sweet and so gross, we couldn't gag it down and it was used aujus for the beef dip sandwich which ruined it also.  There are many more places in Boise worth going besides this place! We just decided to check it out for lunch before we took some guests for dinner but decided not to take a chance. We will not go back! yuck!

Between the $8 lunch specials, the daily top shelf happy hour, and the weekend dueling pianos, it's a place for enjoying oneself any day of the week. I have hooked more than one downtown employee on their lunches, being affordable, widely varied (brisket and chips, chicken and waffles, and salmon on risotto to name a few) and always excellently executed. The cocktails are also top-notch; it's my favorite Kentucky mule. Add the nice decor and attentive staff and you get a 5-star establishment.
Steak cooked to perfection
Best Steak I have EVER had!!!
This place is amazing. I recommend to try the live music on Fridays and Saturdays. It gets crowded so get early. If you prefer something more quiet go on the week days.

I have never been to the Brick Yard for dinner, but I have made it in for dueling pianos on the weekend and it is a real treat. They performers are super talented and very funny. They like to get everyone involved and the more you interact with them the better the night gets. Everyone needs to stop in and see them at least once.
The food is amazing and the staff is great. Expensive but you get what you pay for. Will come back.
Hot fire
Awesome little place would be 5 stars bit there was a bit of a wait.
Great eats!!!!!

Mother's day brunch 2016: We made our reservation 2 weeks in advance. Food was mediocre for the price of brunch. Chicken fried steak very dry without gravy, but when we asked for the gravy, we had to wait for them to cook it. No reasoning there, folks should not have had to ask or wait for gravy. In regards to reservation, table next to us was empty the whole time we were there, hostess could have set us in the table with chairs. My grandchildren had to go under the table to get in and out.  We were set up against the long sofa, so getting in and out was impossible for half our party. For gratuity that is mandatory for a party of 10 or more, the waiter did  not remove empty dishes, fill empty water glasses, we had to ask for spoons, 10% gratuity would have been warranted not 20% for service not given! Mother's day brunch is very special to my wife with our children and grandchildren, based on today's brunch, we will not be returning!
Best steak house in Boise
Amazing food! The atmosphere was fun,will definitely return.

Food ok, atmosphere ok. Problem was that they catered to the couple with two toddlers, apparently cranky, and would not respond to numerous complaints from us and every other table in the stink/noise zone. 4 other tables that I was aware of. My wife actually went to their table to quiet the iPad babysitter cranked loud enough to drown the piano players.
Pretty good food.  Service was a bit slow but I was with a large group which was probably the reason.  The service was nice and helpful.  I'd come back.
I like the bar and venue here.  It is in a nice part of downtown Boise.

Atmosphere great. Reservations 7:30. Not seated till 8:00. Waited over another hour for entrees. The "medium" filet was raw, not just rare. Scallop dish was mediocre. For those prices, food should be excellent. Won't return

Celebrated our 5 year wedding anniversary here tonight. Everything was wonderful. Started out with a nice glass of wine, followed by the baked Brie appetizer which was amazing. Then the fantastic salad that is made fresh at your table and next came the perfectly cooked Kobe steak and veggies. We finished off with a cup of coffee and cookie sundae. Service and food were great! And with the lovely piano music it was a fantastic setting and evening. I definitely recommend this place to everyone! Thank you Christian and your server assistant for a wonderful evening!

Decided to try a new restaurant to celebrate our 18th wedding anniversary.  The food and service were excellent BUT the host/hostess were appalling.  We had a reservation a month in advance.  Immediately when we arrived we were "sized up" by the host (manager?), after much writing he handed the hostess a slip of paper and we were seated.  Out of the abundance of tables available in the establishment, we were taken to the table by the "traffic door" where the workers come and go and of course one has easy access to the bathrooms.  I asked the hostess if we could have a different table and she replied that she would have to talk with the manager as he had everything "configured" just right; needless to say, we were never given a different table.  Had it not been Valentines Day we would of left in a heartbeat but figured other restaurants would be booked so we chose to stay.  There were at least 3 tables that never filled while we were there.  My husband was in dress slacks/dress shirt and I was in a fitted LBD; people seated after us were in jeans so I don't believe it was an "attire" issue.  When one is paying $40 for a steak, they don't want to have butt's shoved in their faces because their packed in so closely to the next table and delivery door that the workers can't help but bump into them.  Though our waitress and other employees that helped with service once we were seated were wonderful, being sized up at the beginning and given the worse table in the establishment without reconsideration has left us vowing never to return to this establishment.

I have a new favorite restaurant in Downtown Boise. It's better than Chandler's and better than Barbocoa's. First, the staff were all friendly and on top of things, they thoroughly knew the menu and offered great selections. The menu has tons of wonderful choices. It was a delight to have our salads prepared tableside. Even the live piano music was top notch.  It was a perfect evening to celebreate at the Brickyard Grill.

Spent my wife's 29th Birthday here, Top notch place! Service is great, Wine selection is great, Food was amazing. We showed up around 8pm and had the pleasure of eating while the Dueling pianos started. They even pulled her on stage and sang her Happy Birthday...We did have a small problem when they dropped off food, Some tiny mistake that was cleared up quickly and they even went as far as comping the meal and brought us a tray of shots!  Great place to celebrate or have a quite night out.

My wife and I had date night at the Brickyard.  To start off the waiter was very personable and friendly, you could tell he enjoys working there.  Followed by a salad that is hand tossed and built at your table, then a 28 ounce rib eye that was cooked perfectly.  The potato cakes and french onion soup were fabulous.  A very elegant meal for $70.  We have been looking for a steak house and now we found one, great experience.

I am the owner of Idaho Winery Tours, and I have to tell you that a young couple who were on the tour two weeks ago were highly impressed with your restaurant. They said the food was amazing, and the price was fantastic. I'll be recommending you based on their review, even if they didn't write one!  Cheers and Good Cheer!
